introduction.title: What is a MYBA Contract?
introduction.paragraph1: At Menorca Brokers, we ensure that every yacht transaction is conducted under the highest industry standards. To guarantee transparency, security, and trust, we use MYBA Contracts, one of the most recognized and accepted contractual forms in the yacht rental and sale world.
introduction.paragraph2: The MYBA (Mediterranean Yacht Brokers Association) contract is a standard document that regulates the terms and conditions of yacht-related transactions, such as rentals and sales. This contract clearly establishes the rights and obligations of both the owner and the client, minimizing risks and potential misunderstandings.

items.title: Clarity and transparency
items.description: Terms and conditions are clearly defined.

items.title: Legal protection
items.description: Guarantees protection for all parties involved in the transaction.

items.title: Flexibility
items.description: Adapts to various needs, from short-term rentals to complete purchase agreements.

items.title: International standards
items.description: Globally recognized by brokers, operators, and yacht owners.

items.title: Yacht details
items.description: Includes specifications such as name, length, crew, and equipment.

items.title: Agreement duration and terms
items.description: Specific rental dates or purchase conditions.

items.title: Cancellation policy
items.description: Establishes conditions in case of force majeure or cancellation.

items.title: Costs and deposits
items.description: Defines prices, additional fees, and initial payments.

items.title: Terms of use
items.description: Describes how the yacht will be used and client responsibilities.

andreuMartinez.name: Andreu Martinez
bio: Andreu Martínez Parera is a broker with a solid academic background in the maritime field.

Trained at the Spanish Maritime Institute and the Institute of Chartered Shipbrokers in London. Additionally, he holds a degree in Nautical Science with a specialization in Maritime Transport. His education is complemented by a Master's in Maritime Transport Management and Postgraduate training in Logistics and Supply Chain, which has allowed him to develop a comprehensive vision of the sector.

Since 2017, Andreu has accumulated significant experience in the maritime and logistics world. His career began at APM Terminals, part of the MAERSK Group, where he was a member of the operations department in Barcelona. During this stage, he was actively involved in optimizing logistics processes and managing port operations, which gave him a deep understanding of the global supply chain.

In 2019, Andreu took on the responsibility of operations management at the shipping company CMA CGM in Marseille. For more than 4 and a half years, he optimized operations efficiency and coordinated cargo activities, resulting in great productivity and stowage results.

Simultaneously with his professional career, Andreu shared his experience and knowledge as a university professor in the Maritime Business area at the Polytechnic University of Catalonia. Throughout his career, he trained new generations of industry professionals, transmitting his knowledge of logistics and maritime operations.

Currently, Andreu leads Menorca Yacht Brokers, a project that offers a wide range of ship brokerage, charter, and nautical consulting services. Thanks to his academic training and practical experience, Andreu has developed a deep understanding of the maritime sector and its specific needs.
